title: European elections: how the migration issue influenced the French vote
summary: Researchers are analyzing how hostility to immigration is a driving force behind the choice of those who went to the polls on June 9. However, they put the idea of growing racism among the French into perspective.

title: Head of French conservative party expelled as recomposition of the right accelerates
summary: Despite having been voted out by Les Républicains's political committee, Eric Ciotti refused to step down on Wednesday evening, saying he was and 'remained' the party's president.

title: The French conservative party leader surrendered to the far right
summary: The alliance with the far-right Rassemblement National advocated by the president of the Les Républicains party for the legislative elections is more than a transgression.

title: Le Pen on track to dismantle the French right
summary: By agreeing to forge an alliance with the far right, the leader of the conservative party has crossed a line, fulfilling the personal objective of Jean-Marie Le Pen's daughter.

title: Bardella goes back on promise to repeal Macron's pension reform
summary: Eager to appear 'reasonable' on the economic front, the far-right leader said that 'choices will have to be made' in the event of his party's victory in the parliamentary elections.

title: Macron calls on all those 'able to say no to extremes' to back him
summary: The French president said he did not 'want to give the keys to power to the far right in 2027,' during a press conference on Wednesday after calling snap elections.

title: Hamas urges US to put 'pressure' on Israel for permanent Gaza ceasefire
summary: In a statement early Thursday, the Palestinian group urged Antony Blinken to put 'direct pressure' on the Israeli government. The American Secretary of State said Wednesday that a truce and hostage release deal to end the Gaza war was still possible, as he wrapped up a Mideast tour.

title: Argentine riot police disperse protesters with water cannons and tear gas ahead of key Senate vote
summary: Thousands of demonstrators converged around the Congress on Wednesday, as the Senate opened debate on controversial legislation, urging lawmakers to reject President Javier Milei’s program of harsh austerity and economic deregulation.

title: EU announces taxes on Chinese electric cars, Beijing slams 'naked protectionist behavior'
summary: Brussels is seeking to protect European automakers from aggressive competition from Chinese rivals.

title: G7 leaders agree to unblock $50 billion for Ukraine by end of 2024
summary: The French presidency of the G7 said the group of seven leaders had reached an agreement on using profits from frozen Russian assets for Ukraine.

title: From Taylor Swift to Olympic swimming: The transformation of Paris La Défense Arena
summary: Europe's largest venue will host the swimming and para swimming events as well as the water polo finals during the summer Games. It's the outcome of lengthy negotiations between the organizing committee and the venue manager.

title: Basketball legend Jerry West dies at 86
summary: An All-Star in all 14 of his NBA seasons, West was selected to the Basketball Hall of Fame three times and is said to be the inspiration for the NBA logo.

title: Three Jordanian doctors' account of Gaza's descent into hell
summary: The kingdom runs two hospitals in the Palestinian territory. Military doctors, who spent over three months there since the war began, described the extremely harsh conditions under which the sick and wounded are treated.

title: Four industries are responsible for 2.7 million deaths each year in Europe, WHO says
summary: On Wednesday, the World Health Organization's Europe office published a report denouncing the way in which the tobacco, alcohol, ultra-processed food and fossil fuel industries are obstructing health policies.

title: Snap elections in France: How it works, precedents, and consequences
summary: Following the far-right Rassemblement National's sweeping victory in the European elections, Emmanuel Macron has decided to dissolve to the Assemblée Nationale for the first time since 1997.

title: In the chaos of Gaza, merchants take up arms to deliver food
summary: Since the Rafah invasion on May 6, Israel has erratically resumed imports directly with traders, risking the proliferation of armed gangs.

title: Biden camp shows respect for justice after his son's conviction for illegally acquiring a firearm
summary: Hunter Biden was convicted of concealing his drug addiction when purchasing a firearm. Joe Biden rejected any prospect of a presidential pardon.

title: Ukraine in shock after the resignation of a reconstruction official
summary: On the eve of an international conference on reconstruction, a senior official condemned the 'resistance and artificial obstacles' put in the way of his work.

title: A 17th-century synagogue in Belarus has been sold for €12
summary: A Baroque art gem, Slonim's synagogue, the country's second oldest, has been deteriorating since the end of the Second World War. At a new auction, the building was sold to a Russian entrepreneur. Concerns remain over its restoration.

title: In California, the town of Alameda refuses to host a climate geoengineering experiment
summary: This San Francisco Bay area town has decided against continuing an experiment in cloud brightening. The idea is to send as much solar energy as possible back into space to limit global warming.

title: Largest US Protestant denomination calls for IVF restrictions
summary: Delegates at the Southern Baptists' annual convention adopted a resolution on Wednesday criticizing in-vitro fertilization due to the fact that the procedure often results in unused embryos being destroyed. The vote comes as Democrats seek to make reproductive rights a key campaign issue ahead of elections on November 5.

title: Extension of metro line 11 brings Paris and Seine-Saint-Denis closer together
summary: The extension of line 11 from Mairie-des-Lilas to Rosny-Bois-Perrier, which will also serve Romainville, Noisy-le-Sec and Montreuil, is a strategic project for the region. Its inauguration is expected to take place on Thursday, June 13.
